00020     def __init__(self):
00021         self.workingArea = os.getcwd()
00022         self.dry_run = False
00023     ## Check if crab can write to specified site
00024     #
00025     # @type self: CrabController
00026     # @param self: The object pointer.
00027     # @type site string
00028     # @param site The Site symbol [default:T2_DE_RWTH]
00029     # @type path string
00030     # @param path lfn path to check write permission in. see twiki WorkBookCRAB3Tutorial
00031     # @type crablog A logging object instance 
00032     # @param logging Logging object where function adds log messages. Messages
00033     #                 are sent to the prompt if no log object is specified.
00034     def crab_checkwrite(self,site='T2_DE_RWTH',path='noPath',crablog=None):    
00035         cmd = ['crab checkwrite --site %s --voGroup=dcms'%site ]
00036         conditionalLog(crablog,"Checking if user can write in output storage")
00037         if not 'noPath' in path:
00038             cmd[0] +=' --lfn=%s'%(path)
00039         p = subprocess.Popen(cmd,stdout=subprocess.PIPE,stderr=subprocess.PIPE,cwd=r"%s"%self.workingArea,shell=True)
00040         (stringlist,string_err) = p.communicate()
00041         if not "Able to write to /store/user/%s on site %s"%(self.user,site)  in stringlist:
00042             conditionalLog(crablog, "The crab checkwrite command failed for site: %s"%site , 'error')
00043             conditionalLog(crablog, string_err , 'error')
00044             return False
00045         else:
00046             conditionalLog(crablog,"Checkwrite was sucessfully called.")
00047             return True
00048

00060     def crab_submit(self,name,crablog=None):
00061         if self.dry_run:
00062             conditionalLog(crablog,'Dry-run: Created config file. crab command would have been: %s'%cmd)
00063         else:
00064             p = subprocess.Popen(cmd,stdout=subprocess.PIPE,stderr=subprocess.PIPE,stdin=subprocess.PIPE,cwd=r"%s"%self.workingArea,shell=True)
00065             (stringlist,string_err) = p.communicate()
00066             conditionalLog(crablog,"crab sumbit called for task %s"%name)

00068     ## Returns the hn name for a user with valid proxy
00069     #
00070     # @type self: CrabController
00071     # @param self: The object pointer.
00072     # @type crablog A logging object instance 
00073     # @param logging Logging object where function adds log messages. Messages
00074     #                 are sent to the prompt if no log object is specified. 
00075     # @returns users hypernews name
00076     def crab_checkHNname(self,crablog=None):
00077         cmd = 'crab checkHNname --voGroup=dcms'
00078         p = subprocess.Popen(cmd,stdout=subprocess.PIPE,stderr=subprocess.PIPE,cwd=r"%s"%self.workingArea,shell=True)
00079         (string_out,string_err) = p.communicate()
00080         string_out = string_out.split("\n")
00081         for line in string_out:
00082             if "Your CMS HyperNews username is" in line:
00083                 hnname = line.split(":")[1].strip()
00084                 return hnname
00085         return "noHNname"
00086     
00087     ## Check crab status
00088     #
00089     # @type self: CrabController
00090     # @param self: The object pointer.
00091     # @type name string
00092     # @param name The crab3 request name, a.k.a the sample name
00093     # @type crablog A logging object instance 
00094     # @param logging Logging object where function adds log messages. Messages
00095     #                 are sent to the prompt if no log object is specified.   
00096     def crab_status(self,name,crablog=None):
00097         cmd = 'crab status crab_%s --long --json'%name
00098         if self.dry_run:
00099             conditionalLog(crablog,'Dry-run: Created config file. crab command would have been: %s'%cmd)
00100         else:
00101             try:
00102                 p = subprocess.Popen(cmd,stdout=subprocess.PIPE,stderr=subprocess.PIPE,stdin=subprocess.PIPE,cwd=r"%s"%self.workingArea,shell=True)
00103                 (stdout,stderr) = p.communicate()
00104             except:
00105                 conditionalLog(crablog,"error running crab status subprocess for %s"%name,'error')
00106                 sys.exit(1)
00107             
00108             conditionalLog(crablog,"crab status called for task %s"%name)
00109             conditionalLog(crablog,'crab status crab_%s --long --json'%name)
00110             #try to fetch the JSON output fro stdout
00111             try:
00112                 # split output in lines and rverse order
00113                 stdout = stdout.splitlines()
00114                 stdout.reverse()
00115                 # get the json output from stdout    
00116                 rawjson = stdout[1]
00117                 # parse json strin into python json object
00118                 import json
00119                 jsondump = json.dumps(rawjson)
00120                 del rawjson
00121                 statusJSON = json.loads(jsondump)
00122                 del jsondump
00123                 return statusJSON
00124             except:
00125                 conditionalLog( crablog, 'Error parsing crab status json output, please check cout below ', 'error')
00126                 conditionalLog( crablog, stdout, 'error')
00127                 conditionalLog( crablog, "current working directory %s"%self.workingArea, 'error')
00128                 sys.exit(1)
00129

00131     ## Prints log message either to logging object if given or print log message to prompt
00132     #
00133     # @type crablog A logging object instance 
00134     # @param crablog Logging object where function adds log messages. Messages
00135     #                 are sent to the prompt if no log object is specified.  
00136     # @type message string
00137     # @param message  Message which should be written to lof
00138     # @type logtype string
00139     # @param logtype log category for this message (info,error,warning)
00140     def conditionalLog(crablog,message,logtype="info"):
00141         for basetype in ['info','warning','error']:
00142             if basetype in logtype:
00143                 try:
00144                     logToCall = getattr(crablog, basetype)
00145                     logToCall(message)
00146                 except:
00147                     print "%s: %s"%(basetype,message)
00148     
00149     ## Populates a existing optparse parser or returns a new one with options for crab functions
00150     #
00151     # This functions populates a previously created (or new) instance of a
00152     # optparse parser object with options needed by crab functions.
00153     # It is possible to add three kinds of options:
00154     # - options where a error should be raised if the option was previously defined
00155     # - options where previous definitions should be kept
00156     # - options where previous definitions should be overriden
00157     # @type Optparse parser instance
00158     # @param parser A previously created parser oject which should be extenden [default: new instance]
00159     # @return A new or extenden optparse parser instance    
00160     def crab_commandlineOptions(parser = optparse.OptionParser( 'usage: %prog' )):
00161         # we first need to call parse_args with a dummy string at the beginning to
00162         # check for existing options later
00163         (currentoptions, args ) = parser.parse_args([" "])
00164         
00165         # The following block shows how variables should be added, where
00166         # conflicts are possible if the option is overridden by this function
00167         # they raise a value error
00168         #try:
00169         #    parser.add_option( '--someOption',metavar='DIR',default=None,
00170         #                       help='Dummy option for future integration') 
00171         #except OptionConflictError as e:
00172         #    conditionalLog(crablog,"There are conflicts extending the optparse options object",'error')
00173         #    conditionalLog(crablog,e.strerror,'error')
00174           
00175         # options where it is checked if they exists and new options are added
00176         # otherwise
00177         if not hasattr(currentoptions, 'dry_run'):
00178             parser.add_option( '--dry-run', action='store_true', default=False, 
00179                             help='Do everything except calling CRAB or registering samples to the database.' )
00180         if not hasattr(currentoptions, 'workingArea'):
00181             parser.add_option( '--workingArea',metavar='DIR',default=os.getcwd(),help='The area (full or relative path) where to create the CRAB project directory. ' 
00182                                  'If the area doesn\'t exist, CRAB will try to create it using the mkdir command' \
00183                                 ' (without -p option). Defaults to the current working directory.'       )
00184     
00185             
00186         # Some options can be added without expected trouble with other parser
00187         # parts, simply because it is quite fixed what they represent.
00188         # those variables should be added here and will throw no exception if
00189         # they already exist in the parser
00190         #parser.set_conflict_handler('resolve')
00191         #parser.add_option( '--someOption',metavar='DIR',default=None,
00192         #                       help='Dummy option for future integration') 
00193             
00194         return parser
00195
